snippet: Amnesty called on the United Nations to establish a panel of inquiry to investigate what the group’s report called indiscriminate attacks in Yemen.
abstract: Amnesty International report on Yemen conflict accuses both Saudi-led coalition and both pro- and anti-Houthi fighters of war crimes and disregard for civilian safety; asks United Nations to form independent investigative panel.

byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa contributed reporting from Sana, Yemen, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: Amnesty called on the United Nations to establish a panel of inquiry to investigate what the group’s report called indiscriminate attacks in Yemen.

headline.main: Amnesty International Says All Sides in Yemen Have Committed War Crimes
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Yemen: All Sides in Fighting Are Accused of War Crimes

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
